content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-299-02-A
|Item_parent=Intracranial tumours
|Item_parent_short=Intra-cranial tumours
|Rank=A
|Title=Know the definition of primary intracranial tumours: central nervous system and adnexa
|Description=Know the distinction between tumours originating in the CNS and tumours originating in its adnexa
|Rubric=Definition
|Contributors=Dr Thiébaud PICART (Hospices Civils de Lyon),Dr Pierre ANTHÉRIEU (Toulouse University Hospital),Pr François VASSAL (Saint-Etienne University Hospital)
|Order=2}}

- Primary brain tumour =''' intra-axial, developed within the brain itself (i.e. brain, trunk, cerebellum), e.g. glioblastoma

- Primary adnexal tumour = extra-axial, developed from the meninges and cranial nerves, e.g. meningioma and schwannoma/neuroma of the vestibular nerve.

question.title: What type of tumour originates from the meninges and cranial nerves?
question.description: Identify the type of tumour that develops from the meninges and cranial nerves.

option_a.title: Intra-axial tumour
option_a.description: A tumour developed within the brain itself

option_b.title: Extra-axial tumour
option_b.description: A tumour developed from the meninges and cranial nerves

option_c.title: Central nervous system tumour
option_c.description: A tumour originating from the CNS

option_d.title: Peripheral nervous system tumour
option_d.description: A tumour originating from the PNS
